intro: Erisma blancoa, commonly known as the white erisma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its flowers are white or pale pink and bloom in late spring to early summer. Erisma blancoa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
